IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AT HAMLINE, OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE A DIVERSE AND COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY OF LEARNERS DEDICATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF STUDENTS' KNOWLEDGE, VALUES, AND SKILLS FOR SUCCESSFUL LIVES OF LEADERSHIP, SCHOLARSHIP, AND SERVICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FOUNDED IN 1854, HAMLINE UNIVERSITY IS A NATIONALLY RANKED COMPREHENSIVE UNIVERSITY SERVING 2,900 STUDENTS IN ITS COLLEGE OF LIBERAL ARTS, SCHOOL OF EDUCATION, AND SCHOOL OF BUSINESS. IT OFFERS UNDERGRADUATE, MASTERS, DOCTORATE AND PROFESSIONAL DEGREES, AS WELL AS CERTIFICATE AND CONTINUING STUDIES PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: HAMLINE UNIVERSITY IS A NATIONALLY-RANKED, COMPREHENSIVE UNIVERSITY SERVING NEARLY 2,900 STUDENTS IN ITS COLLEGE OF LIBERAL ARTS, SCHOOL OF EDUCATION, AND SCHOOL OF BUSINESS. IT OFFERS UNDERGRADUATE, MASTERS, DOCTORAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEGREES, AS WELL AS CERTIFICATE AND CONTINUING STUDIES PROGRAMS. FOUNDED IN 1854, HAMLINE UNIVERSITY WAS THE FIRST INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING IN MINNESOTA. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED A NATIONAL REPUTATION FOR ACADEMIC QUALITY, AS WELL AS PROVIDING STUDENTS WITH PERSONAL ATTENTION AND HIGH-IMPACT LEARNING EXPERIENCES. HAMLINE IS ONE OF JUST 290 PHI BETA KAPPA INSTITUTIONS IN THE UNITED STATES. AMONG COMPREHENSIVE UNIVERSITIES, U.S. NEWS AND WORLD REPORT RANKS HAMLINE AS ONE OF THE TOP-RANKED MINNESOTA UNIVERSITIES IN ITS CATEGORY OF BEST REGIONAL UNIVERSITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HAMLINE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ACADEMIC SUPPORT TO ITS STUDENTS THROUGH SUPPORT SERVICES THAT ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE UNIVERSITY'S PRIMARY MISSION OF INSTRUCTION. THIS INCLUDES EXPENSES FOR LIBRARIES, GALLERIES, AUDIO/VISUAL SERVICES, ACADEMIC DEVELOPMENT, ACADEMIC COMPUTING SUPPORT, COURSE AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, AND ACADEMIC ADMINISTRATION. THE REVENUE INCLUDES CONTRACTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HAMLINE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES STUDENT SERVICES TO ITS STUDENTS AND INCLUDES SUCH EXPENSES AS ADMISSIONS, FINANCIAL AID, ADMINISTRATION, REGISTRAR ACTIVITIES, AND ACTIVITIES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO STUDENTS' EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL WELL-BEING AND TO THEIR INTELLECTUAL, CULTURAL, AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT OUTSIDE THE CONTEXT OF THE FORMAL INSTRUCTIONAL PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: HAMLINE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES AUXILIARY SERVICES TO STUDENTS WHICH ARE ESSENTIALLY THE SELF SUPPORTING OPERATIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY. THESE SERVICES CHARGE A FEE TO STUDENTS THAT IS DIRECTLY RELATED TO, ALTHOUGH NOT NECESSARILY EQUAL TO, THE COST OF PROVIDING THE SERVICE. EXAMPLES ARE RESIDENCE HALLS, STUDENT HEALTH SERVICES, AND THE CAMPUS BOOKSTORE.
EXPENDITURES OF THOSE OFFICES AND ACTIVITIES WHOSE PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: DEAN OF COLLEGE OF LIBERAL ARTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY IS A MEMBER OF MINNESOTA PRIVATE COLLEGE COUNCIL (MPCC), AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(4) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MPCC IS AN ASSOCIATION OF PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION THAT SERVES A VARIETY OF ITS MEMBERS' SHARED NEEDS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT ONLY, NONPARTISAN AND NON-ELECTORAL ADVOCACY FOR PUBLIC POLICY THAT MEETS STUDENTS' NEEDS AND ADVANCES THE INTERESTS OF PRIVATE HIGHER EDUCATION. THE UNIVERSITY PAID MEMBERSHIP DUES TO MPCC IN THE AMOUNT OF $160,604 DURING THE TAXABLE YEAR. MPCC HAS DIVIDED ITS EXPENSES FOR ITS TAXABLE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2022, INTO TWO GROUPS. GROUP 1 CONSISTS OF THOSE EXPENSES THAT DID NOT IN ANY WAY SUPPORT ATTEMPTS TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ("LOBBYING"), AND GROUP 2 CONSISTS OF ALL OTHER EXPENSES. GROUP 2 INCLUDES MANY EXPENSES, SUCH AS PERSONNEL COSTS, THAT SUPPORTED BOTH LOBBYING AND NONLOBBYING ACTIVITIES. MPCC DID NOT ATTEMPT TO ALLOCATE THE GROUP 2 EXPENSES BETWEEN LOBBYING AND NONLOBBYING ACTIVITIES. MPCC HAS DETERMINED THAT THE AMOUNT OF THE GROUP 2 EXPENSES REPRESENTS 77.89% OF THE AMOUNT OF THE DUES THAT MPCC COLLECTED IN THE SAME TAXABLE YEAR. ASSUMING THAT ALL GROUP 2 EXPENSES WERE PAID FROM MEMBER DUES, AND ALLOCATING THOSE EXPENSES PRO RATA BASED ON THE DUES PAID BY EACH MEMBER, $110,880 OF THE UNIVERSITY'S DUES WERE USED TO PAY GROUP 2 EXPENSES. THE AMOUNT OF LOBBYING EXPENSES PAID FROM THE UNIVERSITY'S DUES WAS SIGNIFICANTLY LESS THAN THAT AMOUNT. THIS AMOUNT OF GROUP 2 EXPENSES ARE SHOWN IN CONFERENCES, CONVENTIONS AND MEETINGS, PART IX, LINE 19.

THE UNIVERSITY'S COLLECTIONS, WHICH WERE ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE THE UNIVERSITY'S INCEPTION, ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE BALANCE SHEET. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN NET ASSETS WITHOUT DONOR RESTRICTIONS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE ITEMS ARE ACQUIRED OR AS NET ASSETS WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS IF THE ASSETS THAT ARE USED TO PURCHASE THE ITEMS ARE RESTRICTED BY THE DONORS. CONTRIBUTED COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT REFLECTED ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEEDS FROM DE-ACCESSIONS OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED AS INCREASES IN THE APPROPRIATE NET ASSET CLASSES.

THE UNIVERSITY'S COLLECTION IS MADE UP OF POTTERY, PRINTS, MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS AND PAINTINGS THAT ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND PERFORMANCE PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS IS CATALOGUED, PRESERVED AND CARED FOR AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED CONTINUOUSLY.

THE INTENDED USES OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE TO ESTABLISH A SCHOLARSHIP OR PRIZE, TO CREATE A CHAIR IN A SPECIFIC ACADEMIC AREA, TO FUND A PARTICULAR RESEARCH PROGRAM, TO FUND OTHER PROGRAMS SUCH AS PROFESSORSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, LIBRARY, BUILDINGS, EQUIPMENT AND LECTURES AND DISCRETIONARY USE BY THE UNIVERSITY (UNRESTRICTED).

THE IRS HAS DETERMINED THAT THE UNIVERSITY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT IS ALSO EXEMPT FROM STATE INCOME TAX. HOWEVER, ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME MAY BE SUBJECT TO TAXATION. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ADOPTED THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD RELATING TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. THIS STANDARD CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS STANDARD HAD NO IMPACT ON THEM UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHANGE IN SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENT -251,861. COGS 2,097,780. BOARD DESIGNATED UNRESTRICTED SPENDING -144,391.
GRANTS & FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE NETTED AGAINST TUITION REVENUE 40,926,950.
COGS 2,097,780. BOARD DESIGNATED UNRESTRICTED SPENDING -144,391.
GRANTS & FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE NETTED AGAINST TUITION REVENUE 40,926,950.

THE UNIVERSITY PUBLICIZES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POSITION IN ALL MAJOR PUBLICATIONS, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO ADMISSION AND STUDENT SERVICES AND HAMLINE MAGAZINE AS WELL AS ON THE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE.
THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDING, INCLUDING CARES ACT FUNDING

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY FOR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE UNIVERSITY'S ESTABLISHED CRITERIA WHICH FOLLOWS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES FOR AWARDING ANY GRANT FUNDS. THERE IS AN ANNUAL AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS.
THE ACCRUAL METHOD IS BEING USED TO ACCOUNT FOR FOREIGN EXPENDITURES.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: EDUCATIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ACCORDING TO THE UNIVERSITY'S ESTABLISHED CRITERIA WHICH FOLLOWS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES FOR AWARDING ANY GRANT FUNDS. THERE IS AN ANNUAL AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MONITOR USAGE OF FUNDS FOR GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: DEAN OF COLLEGE OF LIBERAL ARTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FIRST CLASS TRAVEL EXPENSES FOR THE PRESIDENT WERE PAID AND WERE NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS FOR THE PRESIDENT WAS PAID AND WAS NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. TAX INDEMNIFICATION AND GROSS-UP PAYMENTS FOR THE PRESIDENT WERE PAID AND WERE INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. RESIDENCE FOR PERSONAL USE WAS PROVIDED TO THE PRESIDENT AND WAS NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. SOCIAL CLUB DUES FOR THE PRESIDENT WERE PAID AND WERE NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE INCOME. PERSONAL SERVICES FOR THE PRESIDENT WERE PAID AND WERE NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE INCOME.

THE DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT AND VP FOR FINANCE & ADMIN INCLUDED A REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, REVIEW OF COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DECISION. THE LAST INDEPENDENT REVIEW WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2021.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: DEFEASE TWO PRIOR BONDS AND ADD CONSTRUCTION FUNDING
REFUND PRIOR BOND AND CONSTRUCTION PROJECT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER IN COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, ALL OF WHOM SHALL BE VOTING TRUSTEES. THE MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL INCLUDE THE CHAIR, VICE CHAIR, SECRETARY, TREASURER AND EACH CHAIR OF THE BOARD STANDING COMMITTEE. IN ADDITION, ONE OR TWO TRUSTEES MAY BE NOMINATED BY THE COMMITTEE CHARGED WITH TRUSTEESHIP MATTERS AND ELECTED BY THE BOARD TO SERVE IN AT-LARGE POSITIONS ON THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE PURPOSE OF THE FUNCTIONS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ARE: (1) TO HELP THE PRESIDENT TO ADDRESS BUSINESS BETWEEN REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS; (2) TO ASSIST THE CHAIR AND THE PRESIDENT WITH THEIR JOINT RESPONSIBILITY TO HELP THE BOARD FUNCTION EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY BY SUGGESTING BOARD MEETING AGENDA ITEMS AND PERIODICALLY ASSESSING THE QUALITY OF COMMITTEE WORK; (3) TO REVIEW AS NEEDED SIGNIFICANT COMPENSATION, INCENTIVE AND BENEFIT PLANS FOR UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES; AND (4) TO PERFORM AN ANNUAL EVALUATION OF THE PRESIDENT, AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REGARDING THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION. DURING INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND SUBJECT TO THE CONTROL AND DIRECTION OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND MAY EXERCISE ALL OF THE AUTHORITY AND POWERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE AFFAIRS OF THE UNIVERSITY, PROVIDED THAT THE FOLLOWING MATTERS SHALL BE RESERVED FOR THE BOARD: PRESIDENTIAL SELECTION AND TERMINATION; TRUSTEE NOMINATIONS AND ELECTIONS OF OFFICERS OF THE BOARD; CHANGES IN INSTITUTIONAL MISSION AND PURPOSES; AMENDMENTS TO THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS; INCURRING OF CORPORATE INDEBTEDNESS; SALE OF UNIVERSITY ASSETS OR TANGIBLE PROPERTY; ADOPTION OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET; AND CONFERRAL OF DEGREES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MAY ACT TO FURTHER LIMIT THE DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. IN ADDITION TO ITS AUTHORITY TO TAKE ACTION OF MATTERS THAT CANNOT OR SHOULD NOT BE DEFERRED TO THE BOARD'S NEXT SCHEDULED MEETING, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL OVERSEE THE WORK OF BOARD COMMITTEES, AND OVERSEE THE UNIVERSITY'S PLANNING PROCESS AND PROGRESS ON PLANNING GOALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. THE AUDIT SUBCOMMITTEE AND THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWED A PUBLIC INSPECTION VERSION OF THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TRUSTEES, LIFE TRUSTEES, AND OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN A DISCLOSURE FORM INFORMING THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THEY MAY HAVE A MATERIAL, FINANCIAL, OR OTHER INTEREST IN. WHEN THE UNIVERSITY ENTERS INTO A CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION THAT MAY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A COVERED MEMBER, THIS ISSUE IS BROUGHT TO THE BOARD TO BE REVIEWED. DURING THESE PROCEEDINGS, ALL MATERIAL FACTS AS TO THE CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND FULLY DISCLOSED BY THE COVERED MEMBER. THEN THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MUST AUTHORIZE, APPROVE, OR RATIFY THE CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION WITHOUT THE VOTE OF THE COVERED MEMBER. THE BOARD MUST DETERMINE IF THE TRANSACTION IS IN GOOD FAITH AND A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS MUST VOTE TO APPROVE THE TRANSACTION OR CONTRACT. THE PROCEEDINGS ARE THEN RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT AND VP FOR FINANCE & ADMIN INCLUDED A REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, REVIEW OF COMPARABILITY DATA AND CONTEMPORANEOUS SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DECISION. THE LAST INDEPENDENT REVIEW WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT THE MINNESOTA SECRETARY OF STATE'S OFFICE. THE UNIVERSITY'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON ITS WEBSITE. THE UNIVERSITY'S FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE AT GUIDESTAR.ORG OR UPON REQUEST. THE UNIVERSITY'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON ITS WEBSITE.
CHANGE IN SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENT -251,861.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
